page.title: 06Leisure & Recreation (2)
page.content:
The Moyfield Riding School in South Littleton has about fifty acres of grazing and stabling for one hundred horses. The school employes six people and approximately one hundred people use the stables every week.
Children have to go to nearby villages for Cub Scouts, Scouts, Brownies, Guides, Swimming, Judo and Youth Clubs. However, television is a popular pastime with all ages. Adults persue a variety of hobbies, a popular one being gardening, but again many have to go out of their village for other activities. Nevertheless, there is a strong community spirit within the area. People are friendly and helpful to each other and welcome new comers.
